Key Match Events: Tamm (38') scored the only goal for Estonia, while Robert Shein (90') scored a consolation goal for Estonia
Suslov (70') was sent off for Slovakia
Obert (28'), Bozenik (55'), Vavro (87'), Dubravka (90+5'), Calzona (90+6'), Hancko (90+5') were also sent off for Slovakia
Pre-Game Insights: Estonia are coming into this match following a number of friendly fixtures in 2024, whilst the Falcons are still reeling from Euro 2024 heartbreak.
Estonia have indulged in four friendly fixtures during the 2024 international calendar to date, including a penalty-shootout success over Lithuania on June 11.

The Blueshirts have also enjoyed their biggest victory in terms of scoreline since the 4-0 thrashing of European minnows San Marino in September 2022, with Thursday's hosts recording a 4-1 success over the Faroe Islands, who were definitely second best on the night in Tallinn.
Slovakia competed against some of Europe's elite sides over the summer, meaning that they should have no issues easing past the Blueshirts during a Nations League opener.
Estonia have not performed on the competitive stage for a while and could struggle in Tallinn on Thursday night.
Post-Match Reflections: Estonia's coach will be disappointed with the result and the number of yellow and red cards his team received.
Slovakia's coach will be pleased with the win and the performance of his team, especially after the heartbreak of Euro 2024.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at A. Le Coq Arena in Estonia.
The match was played on September 5, 2024 at 7.45pm UK.
Others: The UEFA Nations League C game saw Estonia lose 0-1 to Slovakia, with Tamm scoring the only goal for Estonia in the 38th minute.
